releases.details: The West Wing: The Complete First Season

notes: This episode marks the first appearance of Joey Lucas, a key recurring character.
The subplot involving the Vice President and the ethanol tax credits reflects real legislative issues at the time.

in_universe_mythology: Discussion of the flag desecration amendment proposing a conflict between First Amendment rights and national symbols.
real_world_cultural_references: References to contemporary politics surrounding LGBTQ+ rights and military service.

continuity_notes: Establishes ongoing political tensions in the series regarding LGBTQ+ issues in the military.

plot.plot_summary: In this episode, President Bartlet travels to Los Angeles for a fundraiser hosted by Ted Marcus, who pressures him to oppose a congressional bill on military service by LGBTQ+ individuals. Meanwhile, Leo McGarry attempts to persuade Vice President Hoynes to break a Senate deadlock over an ethanol tax credit. In Los Angeles, romantic tensions emerge as Josh Lyman discovers that his former crush, Joey Lucas, is also attending the event, leading to comedic and poignant moments that explore the personal connections and political responsibilities of the characters.
